intro: Paramollugo digyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mossy grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an important component of understory vegetation in tropical and subtropical regions.
